name: Oh! It's SunnyLand!
description:
The journey of Him and his cat in the process of finding themselves.

---------------------------`ღ´---------------------------

Him was born into a helpless situation and, as such, he had to face the relentless pressures of life. Despite the hardships he faced, he moved to the city to pursue his dreams, and he was able to get into university. To balance his studies and work, he lived in a small house with affordable rent near the school. However, the pressure of constantly having to maintain this balance took a toll on his spirit, and he gradually became more and more stressed and depressed. It seemed as though he was stuck in a never-ending cycle of stress and anxiety.

One day, Him found himself suddenly trapped in another world and transformed into a little fox. He must travel through the vibrant world of "Oh! It's SunnyLand!" to unravel the mystery of his transformation and the nature of the world he has found himself.

As he journeys through this strange land, Him must not only face various challenges and obstacles but also come to terms with the events and emotions of his past. The game's strong psychological elements delve into the psychological effects that pressure can have on young people's lives, exploring themes of anxiety, depression, and self-doubt. The game offers a cathartic experience, allowing players to confront these difficult emotions and come out on the other side with a sense of self-awareness and inner strength.

---------------------------`ღ´---------------------------

With its charming pixel graphics and engaging platform mechanics, "Oh! It's SunnyLand!" offers an immersive gaming experience that combines nostalgia with a fresh and exciting twist. The game is a powerful reminder of the importance of confronting one's emotions and the importance of self-care in the face of life's difficulties. Join Him on his emotional journey through the land of eternal sunshine and discover the healing power of self-discovery.

Note: the game can be annoying, and the difficulty is relatively high.
